name: Qualifying central counterparty (QCCP)
description:
A qualifying central counterparty (QCCP) is an entity that is licensed to operate as a CCP by the relevant
regulator and that is based and prudentially supervised in a jurisdiction where the
relevant regulator has implemented domestic rules for financial market infrastructures that are consistent with the PFMIs by
CPMI-IOSCO. (Basel Committee on Banking Supervision Capital requirements for bank exposures to central counterparties)
